name: Neil Kinnock MP
description:
Kinnock supported the aim of the strike – which he dubbed the "case for coal" – but, as an MP from a mining area, was bitterly critical of the tactics employed.

In an interview 25 years ago later he launched a fresh attack on the miners' leader, Arthur Scargill, saying that Margaret Thatcher was lucky during the dispute because of "the madness with which the miners were led into the jaws of defeat".
